text: INTRODUCTION
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Before there stood gods upon Olympus, or ever Allah was Allah, had
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wrought and rested MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There are in Pegana Mung and Sish and Kib, and the maker of all
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: small gods, who is MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI. Moreover, we have a faith in
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Roon and Slid.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And it has been said of old that all things that have been were
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wrought by the small gods, excepting only MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI, who
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made the gods and hath thereafter rested.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And none may pray to MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI but only the gods whom he
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hath made.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But at the Last will MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI forget to rest, and will
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: make again new gods and other worlds, and will destroy the gods
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whom he hath made.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the gods and the worlds shall depart, and there shall be only
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OF SKARL THE DRUMMER
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI had made the gods and Skarl, Skarl made a
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drum, and began to beat upon it that he might drum for ever. Then
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: because he was weary after the making of the gods, and because of
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the drumming of Skarl, did MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI grow drowsy and fall
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: asleep.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there fell a hush upon the gods when they saw that MANA rested,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and there was silence on Pegana save for the drumming of Skarl.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Skarl sitteth upon the mist before the feet of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: above the gods of Pegana, and there he beateth his drum. Some say
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that the Worlds and the Suns are but the echoes of the drumming of
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Skarl, and others say that they be dreams that arise in the mind
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of MANA because of the drumming of Skarl, as one may dream whose
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rest is troubled by sound of song, but none knoweth, for who hath
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heard the voice of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI, or who hath seen his drummer?
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Whether the season be winter or whether it be summer, whether it
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be morning among the worlds or whether it be night, Skarl still
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beateth his drum, for the purposes of the gods are not yet fulfilled.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sometimes the arm of Skarl grows weary; but still he beateth his
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drum, that the gods may do the work of the gods, and the worlds go
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on, for if he cease for an instant then MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI will start
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: awake, and there will be worlds nor gods no more.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But, when at the last the arm of Skarl shall cease to beat his drum,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence shall startle Pegana like thunder in a cave, and MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shall cease to rest.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then shall Skarl put his drum upon his back and walk forth into the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: void beyond the worlds, because it is THE END, and the work of Skarl
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: is over.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There may arise some other god whom Skarl may serve, or it may be
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he shall perish; but to Skarl it shall matter not, for he shall
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have done the work of Skarl.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OF THE MAKING OF THE WORLDS
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI had made the gods there were only the gods,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and They sat in the middle of Time, for there was as much Time
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before them as behind them, which having no end had neither a
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beginning.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Pegana was without heat or light or sound, save for the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drumming of Skarl; moreover Pegana was The Middle of All, for
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there was below Pegana what there was above it, and there lay
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before it that which lay beyond.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods, making the signs of the gods and speaking with
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their hands lest the silence of Pegana should blush; then said the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods to one another, speaking with Their hands; "Let Us make
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds to amuse Ourselves while MANA rests. Let Us make worlds and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Life and Death, and colours in the sky; only let Us not break the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence upon Pegana."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then raising Their hands, each god according to his sign, They
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made the worlds and the suns, and put a light in the houses of the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sky.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods: "Let Us make one to seek, to seek and never to
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: find out concerning the wherefore of the making of the gods."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They made by the lifting of Their hands, each god according to
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his sign, the Bright One with the flaring tail to seek from the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: end of the Worlds to the end of them again, to return again after
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a hundred years.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Man, when thou seest the comet, know that another seeketh besides
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thee nor ever findeth out.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods, still speaking with Their hands: "Let there be
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now a Watcher to regard."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They made the Moon, with his face wrinkled with many mountains
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and worn with a thousand valleys, to regard with pale eyes the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: games of the small gods, and to watch throughout the resting time
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI; to watch, to regard all things, and be
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silent.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then said the gods: "Let Us make one to rest. One not to move
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among the moving. One not to seek like the comet, nor to go round
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like the worlds; to rest while MANA rests."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They made the Star of the Abiding and set it in the North.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Man, when thou seest the Star of the Abiding to the North, know
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that one resteth as doth MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI, and know that somewhere
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among the Worlds is rest.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lastly the gods said: "We have made worlds and suns, and one to
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seek and another to regard, let Us now make one to wonder."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They made Earth to wonder, each god by the uplifting of his
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand according to his sign.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Earth was.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: OF THE GAME OF THE GODS
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A million years passed over the first game of the gods. And
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI still rested, still in the middle of Time, and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gods still played with Worlds. The Moon regarded, and the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Bright One sought, and returned again to his seeking.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then Kib grew weary of the first game of the gods, and raised his
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand in Pegana, making the sign of Kib, and Earth became covered
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with beasts for Kib to play with.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Kib played with beasts.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the other gods said one to another, speaking with their hands:
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "What is it that Kib has done?"
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And They said to Kib: "What are these things that move upon The
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Earth yet move not in circles like the Worlds, that regard like
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Moon and yet they do not shine?"
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Kib said: "This is Life."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the gods said one to another: "If Kib has thus made beasts he
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: will in time make Men, and will endanger the Secret of the gods."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Mung was jealous of the work of Kib, and sent down Death among
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the beasts, but could not stamp them out.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A million years passed over the second game of the gods, and still
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it was the Middle of Time.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Kib grew weary of the second game, and raised his hand in the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Middle of All, making the sign of Kib, and made Men: out of beasts
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he made them, and Earth was covered with Men.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the gods feared greatly for the Secret of the gods, and set a
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: veil between Man and his ignorance that he might not understand.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Mung was busy among Men.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But when the other gods saw Kib playing his new game They came and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: played it too. And this They will play until MANA arises to rebuke
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Them, saying: "What do ye playing with Worlds and Suns and Men and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Life and Death?" And They shall be ashamed of Their playing in the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hour of the laughter of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was Kib who first broke the Silence of Pegana, by speaking with
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his mouth like a man.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And all the other gods were angry with Kib that he had spoken with
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his mouth.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there was no longer silence in Pegana or the Worlds.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE CHAUNT OF THE GODS
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There came the voice of the gods singing the chaunt of the gods,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: singing: "We are the gods; We are the little games of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he hath played and hath forgotten.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI hath made us, and We made the Worlds and the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Suns.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And We play with the Worlds and the Sun and Life and Death until
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MANA arises to rebuke us, saying: 'What do ye playing with Worlds
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Suns?'
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is a very serious thing that there be Worlds and Suns, and yet
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: most withering is the laughter of MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And when he arises from resting at the Last, and laughs at us for
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: playing with Worlds and Suns, We will hastily put them behind us,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and there shall be Worlds no more."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE SAYINGS OF KIB
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: (Sender of Life in all the Worlds)
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kib said: "I am Kib. I am none other than Kib."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kib is Kib. Kib is he and no other. Believe! Kib said: "When
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Time was early, when Time was very early indeed--there was only
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI. MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI was before the beginning of the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gods, and shall be after their going."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Kib said: "After the going of the gods there will be no small
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: worlds nor big."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kib said: "It will be lonely for MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI."
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Because this is written, believe! For is it not written, or are
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: you greater than Kib? Kib is Kib.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: CONCERNING SISH
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: (The Destroyer of Hours)
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Time is the hound of Sish.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At Sish's bidding do the hours run before him as he goeth upon
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his way.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Never hath Sish stepped backward nor ever hath he tarried; never
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hath he relented to the things that once he knew nor turned to
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them again.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Before Sish is Kib, and behind him goeth Mung.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Very pleasant are all things before the face of Sish, but behind
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him they are withered and old.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Sish goeth ceaselessly upon his way.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once the gods walked upon Earth as men walk and spake with their
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mouths like Men. That was in Wornath-Mavai. They walk not now.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Wornath-Mavai was a garden fairer than all the gardens upon
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Earth.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kib was propitious, and Mung raised not his hand against it,
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: neither did Sish assail it with his hours.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Wornath-Mavai lieth in a valley and looketh towards the south, and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on the slopes of it Sish rested among the flowers when Sish was
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: young.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thence Sish went forth into the world to destroy its cities, and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to provoke his hours to assail all things, and to batter against
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them with the rust and with the dust.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Time, which is the hound of Sish, devoured all things; and
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sish sent up the ivy and fostered weeds, and dust fell from the
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand of Sish and covered stately things. Only the valley where
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sish rested when he and Time were young did Sish not provoke his
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hours to assail.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There he restrained his old hound Time, and at its borders Mung
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: withheld his footsteps.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Wornath-Mavai still lieth looking towards the south, a garden
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among gardens, and still the flowers grow about its slopes as they
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grew when the gods were young; and even the butterflies live in
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Wornath-Mavai still. For the minds of the gods relent towards
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their earliest memories, who relent not otherwise at all.
title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Wornath-Mavai still lieth looking towards the south; but if thou

title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Slid said: "Let no man pray to MANA-YOOD-SUSHAI, for who shall
title: The Gods of Pegana

title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: The Gods of Pegana

title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: The Gods of Pegana
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: been said.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: The Gods of Pegana

title: The Gods of Pegana

author: Dunsany, Lord
